structure.unit: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES -- PROHIBITIONS, RESTRICTIONS, AND REGULATIONS

law.catch_line: Retail premises to furnish clear view from sidewalk or entrance.
law.text: The entrance of any premises for which a retail license has been issued shall be of clear glass and permit an unobstructed view. The premises shall be so erected and maintained as to furnish a clear view of the premises from the sidewalk, or, if the premises are not on the street level, from the entrance. No partition, box, stall, screen, curtain, or other device shall obstruct the view or the general observation of persons, but partitions, subdivisions, or panels that are not higher than forty-eight (48) inches from the floor shall not be construed as obstructing the view or the general observation of persons.
law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 27, effective July 15, 1998. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-176.
